comments.value:
Hi folks.

We've had a request from the Local Leaders team to make the social sharing functionality (as we currently have in the footer for Facebook and Twitter) more prominent and more specific.

If you look here: http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/local-leaders/index.php you'll see there are 8 different 'products' which are going to make up the Local Leaders campaign as a whole ('Garden for the Games', 'Opening Night In' etc). As I understand it these products are going to have their own pages soon and the Local Leaders team want to embed clearly branded 'Like' and 'Tweet' buttons into the body of each page. They also want to make sure that


a)      The resulting pre-populated Facebook and Twitter posts contain more specific copy than just e.g. the page title. See here: http://mascot-games.london2012.com/#/customiser for where we achieved this for the mascot site (share buttons for Twitter and Facebook are in the bottom right)

b)      An appropriate thumbnail is pulled through on the Facebook post.

I know this raises a few issues that we've discussed previously:


1)      Can we resolve this Facebook thumbnail issue? Forgive the repetition as I know Danny in particular has explained the issue to me previously and we've put the idea of fixing it on hold. It would be great if you could remind me and give Tom an idea of what it would take to resolve this?

2)      Ditto re: how much we can customise the copy the content that is pre-populated into Twitter / Facebook posts.

The final question is can you please give me some estimates of how long it would take to do the work required (if possible?). The Local Leaders team are looking for an estimate.

Cheers all, hope that makes sense...

Finn Concannon (@finndc)
Lead Social Media Producer
LOCOG New Media
Direct line:  +44 (0)20 3 2012 918

www.twitter.com/london2012
www.facebook.com/london2012
www.youtube.com/london2012

It should be OK if we get the text changes in good time.

Can we keep the current form where it is (it is now passing ID=2 as requested a while back) and just make a couple of text amends.

If so that should be fine (it it really is just small text amends)

If we need to move/copy the form it's a bit tricker as the first form is in two parts which are tied together.

Jamie
Great – I can probably make most changes myself though.

Was going to say most of the text you can change yourself, it's probably just the labels or help text well need to update (but neither of those should be that onerous if the structure / position of the text stays the same).

Please find attached the changes.

There is only one change for you – in the terms and conditions.

Is it possible to do this change this pm so we can be live tomorrow morning? (Though actually as I understand we are already live – so we just need to relink to the form?)

5. I am available to attend auditions that will take place in the afternoon, evenings or weekend during February 2012 *

6. I understand that being a volunteer performer for Ceremonies requires: *

    * Participating in two to three rehearsal sessions each week of up to four hours per session from April 2012 and;

done.

- the mobile version
- facebook commenting
- cogaopp updates and accessibility fixes

Marking as high priority.

Current priorities: 
- get mobile site working on staging on all templates https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/21649025 
- most recent cogapp amendments https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/21662849

Note, we want mobile working on live, but *not* automatic agent detection, so that the templates can be looked at by Abilitynet before releasing mobile to a wider audience.

comments.value:
From: Kavita Kapoor <Kavita.Kapoor@london2012.com>

We have a new project request. Potentially.

At each venue LOCOG will provide Games Mobility devices, you know
scooters and golf buggies etc.

We may wish to Create an online form via KitSite from approx Nov/Dec
to Apr/May. Information in the form would include; venue (drop down);
date (corresponding to venue); booking out and in times (based on
on-hours); vehicle type (3 in total but varies per venue therefore
these need to line up); name; contact number; email address; and other
comments (an open text box for questions/queries).

Ideally these requests would go direct to a mailbox e.g.
GamesMobility@london2012.com) and LOCOG will respond with a
confirmation or decline email (copy to be signed off by Kathryn) and
fed into SharePoint. However I think we can persuade this team to pick
up a spreadsheet instead like Young Games Makers.

Could I get a price for doing this bearing in mind that we have
alternative ways to service the request.

Kavita
Discussed briefly, with costs in the £15-25k range.
Update : Waiting for the customer to decide if they want a front end form. Back end management will be completed in house using SharePoint.

Hi Danny

The customer has decided that she is going to use our Contact Centre to manage the requests. Do this not needed.

Sorry to get your hopes up!

Kavita

NOT PROTECTIVELY MARKED Hi both, Hope you're well? Thanks once again for all your hard work and patience with the Learning Legacy website. Everyone here is delighted with it. There are now a few last things we need to do to complete the site before I leave the ODA (in December). I have outlined the final tasks below. Please can you take a look and send over a quote for this work? I think we will need a quick chat to go through all of this in detail so that I'm as clear as I can be on what we require - how about Monday? 1. Analytics - we are being harassed about measuring the number of people visiting the site, which is absolutely something we should have thought about before. What is the cost to build the capacity to measure the number of people visiting the home page? And also another cost for the home page and theme pages? This is quite urgent, so it would be great to get this set up ASAP. 2. Accessibility - there is an issue with the accessibility style sheets, as in they don't look great. AbilityNet picked up that the pages should 'render with a layout similar to the normal site, but with bigger text and more contrasting colours'. I know you've advised that doing that would mean effectively designing a new CSS layout/design purely for the accessible versions of each page - please can we get a quote for redesigning the accessible versions of the pages? 3. Flash plug-in - there is an issue with the London 2012 logo/scrolling pictures on the home page in Internet Explorer. I think this is something to do with 'flash plug-ins', as this was the error message that came up when we loaded the site in Firefox at the ICE. Please can you explore and rectify? 4. Alt text on scrolling pictures - we need the alt text to show as a yellow box when hovering over the images so that people know where they are. I think you have said this will require a component/function adding so may have cost implications. Can we get a quote for this please? 5. Archaeology navigation - in order to get the nesting right (to mirror the site map) we had to lose the top level menu when you click on 'The investigations' and 'The sites'. This is not ideal, as it simply doesn't look great. What options do we have to amend/fix this? 6. Full list of publications - The project team want us to add an option on each theme page for a full list of publications per theme (ie a list of all micro reports, case studies, champion products and research summaries for Sustainability). Can we add a link, or another box for this? Would be great to go through the options and costs for this. 7. External links page - we would like to add in External Links for each theme page. I reckon there will be around five external websites for us to link out to, per theme. Maybe this could sit under the 'related links' on the right? Also would be great to discuss options. 8. Technical Overviews - we are publishing some technical overviews of the project, which are external papers that we just need to link to. Because these are overviews of the project, and not theme-specific, are we able to add a tab at the top, which takes you to a page about the overviews? It just needs to be a page, with information about three organisations delivering the overviews. 9. Case study summaries - there are a number of case studies being published by external organisations next year that we have the summaries/abstracts for. We need these summaries to go on the website with links to the full case studies/publishers. I suggest that these go under the case studies section, or we have another 'box' for case study summaries. However, these aren't documents to upload (as with case studies), so there will be no thumbnail and no physical PDF to link to. It will just need to be a generic image, with the summary/abstract to go into the text box next to the thumbnail, and the link will take you to an external website (rather than a PDF). Hope this makes sense? The only other catch is that the links won't be available until next year! Best to talk through this one! 10. LOCOG testing of the website - Colin Miller has been continuing to test the website since we've gone live and has picked up a few 'aesthetic niggles'. I have asked him to outline what these are and will get back to you ASAP. They are not expected to be extensive and I'm hoping we can fix these in-house. Hope this all makes sense. As suggested, let's catch up early next week and then get a lump-sum for all of these changes. I want to ensure that we are very clear from the outset and that you are paid for all the extra work you are doing. Hope you have a lovely weekend. Speak next week. 1) To retrieve the paths for the various page types:

NB: currently we have limited to 50 pages, we can easily amend this later but thought better to limit as the queries can be heavy on the CMS.

https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-news?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg 
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-blogs?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-publications?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-pressreleases?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-videos?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-transcripts?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-photos?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg

- We have kept the info at this top level "light" to save us having to load each page into memory, which is much heavier in terms of processing. 
- If more info is required then you should make a call to the page (see below)
- However is their is info that would be *really* useful to have at the high level do let us know as we may be able to include it without compromising performance. 
- Let us know if you would prefer dates is a different format etc.

2) To retrieve the actual page as XML:

https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/***the_path_to_you_page you_got_from_above_here***?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/blog/2006/12/lucky-dog-launch.php?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg

- Please note that calls to this API should be spaced out (~5 sec) to reduce undue load on the server.
- Ideally, test exports should be done with short runs (~50 pages) rather that retrieving every page of a given type every time (which could put undue load on the CMS)
- Please try and keep runs to a minimum or cache the output.

3) Comments

We have written a single API that returns all comment, a link to the original page (that this comment refers to), type of comment (blog or photo comment), post date and the name/email of the user who posted the comment. Hopefully it is fairly self explanatory.

https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-comments?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg

4) Images and PDF's (as of 23/11/2011):

Images: http://www.london2102.com/image-23-11-2011.tar.gz
Documents: http://www.london2102.com/documents-23-11-2011.tar.gz

Jamie, this is all fab!

I am going to send it to DeltaTre now, and I’ll let you know if they have any questions/comments.

Thank you.

Liz

comments.value: Is there a way to temporarily remove webcams from the site?

Ticket #5094 "Hiding webcams" was closed and merged into this ticket.

Last comment in ticket #5094: Hi Tom,

No it's not as simple as it sounds, we actually have a ticket open which I have been working on a response to.

Part of the problem is we can't easily dependency track all the pages that use that thumbnail (homepage, venue pages, hub pages etc.) and hence which pages need to be automatically republished. We also have the problem that the image isn't currently replaced / suppressed, only the main page that shows the image and possible links to that page.

The ideal solution would probably be a mix of suppression (when a checkbox is checked, we won't return this webcam to hub pages and/or components) but also to replace the image itself (and all the various repurposing / thumbnails of the image) with a holding image, the tricky thing is here is to stop the feed overwriting the 'holding image' when it next runs.

In short, the above is not something we can get in place this afternoon although we can try and push forward the priority on this work.

You should however be able suppress the webcam (via the checkbox on the page) and then republish the page, the homepage and hub pages, I think if you do that the webcam will be removed from the hub and homepage.

Jamie

subject: Re: Issues with the Festival.London2012.com
description:
Hi,
It appears that the design collateral we received for this was missing a few
images.
  /images/presentation/dotted-border-grey.gif
  /images/interface/footer-bg.png
   -> ./images/presentation/footer-bg.png
  /images/presentation/blue-header-submit.png
It also appears that there's a missing error doc, at /error-404.php.
However, this doesn't explain why you only started seeing this behaviour
this morning. The site is a static one and hasn't changed in the last 60
days.
It might take us some time to hunt down the missing images (we might even
have to go back to the designers). Or, alternatively, we could just remove
them from the css files. It appears that no-one has noticed their absence in
60 days so they might not be that important. However ... this isn't a call
that I can make.
Can you give me an indication of what you would like us to do please?
 1. Try to contact the design agency to track down the missing images.
 2. Amend the css files to remove all reference to the above images (as it
would appear their absence is not causing a problem).
In the meantime, I will fix the missing error-404.php.
Thanks in advance,
Kieran
